Appearances

Appearance and Style

Adam is introduced in Season 10, trying to dress as masculine as possible. Often, he wore baggy clothing, such as big, loose jackets, his signature beanie, flannel shirts, baggy pants, and punk style t-shirts, to avoid revealing his FTM secret. Throughout the season, he tones down his baggy attire. He is also sporting mid-length shaggy hair this season.

In the second half of the season, he begins to wear more formal male clothing, such as ties, dress shirts, suits, more flannel shirts, and khaki pants. He has shorter hair this half of the season, and is neatly brushed into bangs on the side.

In Season 11, Adam is mostly seen just in his Degrassi uniform. His hair is short and pushed back in the front. However, he continues to wear loose jackets with his polo shirt. Once he notices he is developing larger breasts, he gets a binder to constrict them. He then begins wearing tighter shirts and feeling more comfortable in them. In season 11.5, its winter again so Adam brings out the heavy baggy jackets.

In Season 12, Adam is beginning to broaden his style choices, and even begins to share clothes with his older brother Drew Torres. His fashion taste this season include leather jackets, flannel shirts, large jackets, punk t-shirts, loose fitting jeans, tighter shirts, and even some thermals during the winter weather. During formal events like dinner with his girlfriend's parents, he wears dress shirts or the classic flannels.

In Season 13, Adam has grown his hair back to a shaggy length, wearing it in a more "emo" fashion. He is seen wearing baseball caps (hiding his bangs underneath when he does), t-shirts, flannel shirts, jackets, and his signature beanie.

Trivia

Adam was the first transgender character to ever be featured on Degrassi, as well as the first transgender person to be a main character in Canadian television history.

Adam was the first scripted teenage trans man character in television history (not including one-time guest roles).

Adam was the first character to wear a binder. The second was Yael Baron.

Four of Adam's crushes, Bianca, Fiona, Becky Baker, and Katie, have also been eyed by his brother, Drew.

Jordan Todosey revealed in an interview that Adam was originally going to be an androgynous lesbian named Zoë.

Adam knew how to play the bass guitar.

Adam was interested in older women: Bianca and Katie, who were a year older and a grade higher than him, and Fiona, who was two years older and a repeating senior at Degrassi. His last girlfriend Becky Baker, however, was in the same grade and around the same age as him.

Adam involuntarily came out to the whole school as a trans man when Bianca ripped open his shirt in the hallway. However, he willingly came out to his best friends, Clare and Eli, after Clare covered for Adam when he dropped his tampons in the school hallway. He later became friends with Bianca for, after she apologized for her behavior.

Adam was one of the two characters on the show to change their name and go by it instead of their assigned birth name, the first being Jane.

Adam, like his step-brother Drew, had the nickname "Grasshopper." Adam was called this by Eli and Drew is called it by Julian. They also share it with Maya, who was called it by Miles.

He played Call Of Duty: Black Ops.

His Twitter

Adam was one of seven characters to get shot on Degrassi. The other six were Claude, Jimmy, Sean, Rick, Spinner, and Damon.

He and Damon were both shot by Vince.

Adam was the second character to be shot in the shoulder. The first was Spinner.

He was the tenth character to die overall, the others being John Wheeler, Helen Wheeler, Claude, Dr. Manning, Rick, J.T., Anson, Cam, and Paula.

Adam was the fourth character to die in a car accident. The first two were John and Helen Wheeler and the third was Albert Manning.

Adam died while attempting to send a text to Becky while driving. He lost focus when he saw a red truck coming and crashed into a tree, sending him into a coma. He passed away during surgery. The unfinished and unsent text message read, "I <3 u Beck."

He was a fan of Die Hard.

Both Adam and J.T. share these following similarities:

They were known for their humor and for being popular, well-liked students.

They both died on their way to reconcile with their ex-girlfriends.

Adam was the co-host of The Degrassi Radio Show with Dave.

In Dead and Gone (2), it was revealed that his birthday may be between April and June when the paramedic said to someone on his walkie-talkie that Adam was 16.

He was afraid of skateboarding.

On two occasions, Adam was by Drew's side after he fell on the ground.

In My Body Is A Cage (1), after Drew had been beaten up by Fitz and Owen.

In Gives You Hell (2), when Drew had lost consciousness due to his concussion.

He was in a band, WhisperHug.

Adam, Eli, Clare, Grace, Frankie, Lola, Hunter, Sean, Marco, and Griffin, all share the same line "Go to hell."

Adam used this line in My Body Is A Cage (1)

Eli used this line in Need You Now (2)

Clare used this line in Scream (2)

Grace used this line in Close to Me

Frankie used this line in Teen Age Riot

Hunter used this line in Finally (1)

Lola used this line in #BreakTheInternet

Sean used this line in This Charming Man

Marco used this line in I Against I

Griffin used this line in Talking In Your Sleep

In My Body Is A Cage (1), it was revealed that he had not come out to his grandmother yet. To this day, it is unknown whether or not he did before his death. It is likely that she found out at his funeral.

All of Adam's first relationships lasted one episode before officially ending it, or officially starting. (Fiona- 1033-1034, Becky- 1221-1222, and Missy- 1227-1228)

Adam had ended up being friends with his ex-girlfriend and his ex-crushes.

His only relationship to last more than one episode was with Becky Baker, as well as her being the only girl he had ever said "I love you" to.

He was the third character to wear a bandage over their nose, the first being Sav, second being Dallas. Adam was the only character who broke his nose from a reason other than being punched (Sav was punched by Riley and Dallas was punched by Eli; Meanwhile, Adam was hit in the face with a volleyball).

He was a fan of Lana Del Rey and other indie pop musicians.

The Memorial Video in Young Forever marks his 76th appearance.

Adam was one of the six heterosexuals to be crushed on by a homosexual. The other five were Griffin (by Marco), Peter (by Riley), Holly J. (by Fiona), Campbell (also by Tristan) and Grace by Zoë.

Adam and Blue Chessex are the only main characters not to speak in their final appearance.

Adam was the third main character who:

Inflict self-harm (he would burn himself as "Gracie"), after Ellie and Darcy.

Wasn't accepted by his love interest's parents; the first was B.L.T, and the second was Anya.

Had a spring fling. The others were Sav, Fiona, and Katie.

Fell into a coma, after Shane and Terri.

Passed away, after J.T. and Cam.
